topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5396408b6368726e70020500#post_5396408b6368726e70020500
EMP 44 was a double stack magazine concept design SMG that never got approved by the Reich, due to it's unappealing appearance. But the dual stack magazine design was later incorporated into a later model of MP40.

VG-1, was a blowback self-loading rifle.

STG-45 was a delayed blowback assault rifle made near the end of the war to replace their more famous costly STG-44 assault rifle. Few were ever fielded. The design became a basis for the G3 rifles made during the Cold War.

Rest, I don't know.

They also had a Volkspistole, made by Walther and Mauser.

Japan had even cruder weapons near the end of the war. Rifles and ammunition made literally by schoolgirls.
